   +----zeta.util.Term

                   +----zeta.content.zirp.UnitAbsy
The pure class interface. 
public class UnitAbsy
  extends AnnotatedTerm
The abstract syntax of units.

Two types of the syntax of units are distinguished: standard Z sections and mSZ classes.

Author:
Wolfgang Grieskamp (wg@cs.tu-berlin.de)
Version: $Id: UnitAbsy.pizza,v 1.3 1998/09/06 15:24:33 wg Exp $

ClassDef(Name, Name[], Name[], Item[])
A mSZ class definition.
Section(Name, Name[], Item[])
A standard Z section.

Section
public case Section(Name name,
                    Name[] parents,
                    Item[] items);
A standard Z section.

Parameters:
name - the unit name of the section
parents - the parent sections this section bases on
items - the items defining the contents of this section

ClassDef

public case ClassDef(Name name,
                     Name[] parents,
                     Name[] formals,
                     Item[] items);
A mSZ class definition.

Parameters:
name - the unit name of the class
parents - the parent sections this class bases on
formals - the formal parameters of this class
items - the items defining the contents of this class
